Replace specified variables with NA where a certain condition is met

Replace specified variables with NA where a certain condition is met

replace_with_na_at(data, .vars, condition)

Arguments

data

dataframe
.vars

The variables to refer to
condition

A condition required to be TRUE to set NA. Here, the condition is specified with a formula, following the syntax: ~.x {condition}. For example, writing ~.x < 20 would mean "where a variable value is less than 20, replace with NA".

Value

a dataframe

Examples


dat_ms <- tibble::tribble(~x,  ~y,    ~z,
                          1,   "A",   -100,
                          3,   "N/A", -99,
                          NA,  NA,    -98,
                          -99, "E",   -101,
                          -98, "F",   -1)

dat_ms
#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>        x y           z
#>    <dbl> <chr>   <dbl>
#> 1   1.00 A     -100   
#> 2   3.00 N/A   - 99.0 
#> 3  NA    <NA>  - 98.0 
#> 4 -99.0  E     -101   
#> 5 -98.0  F     -  1.00

replace_with_na_at(data = dat_ms,
                 .vars = "x",
                 condition = ~.x == -99)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>        x y           z
#>    <dbl> <chr>   <dbl>
#> 1   1.00 A     -100   
#> 2   3.00 N/A   - 99.0 
#> 3  NA    <NA>  - 98.0 
#> 4  NA    E     -101   
#> 5 -98.0  F     -  1.00

replace_with_na_at(data = dat_ms,
                 .vars = c("x","z"),
                 condition = ~.x == -99)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>        x y           z
#>    <dbl> <chr>   <dbl>
#> 1   1.00 A     -100   
#> 2   3.00 N/A     NA   
#> 3  NA    <NA>  - 98.0 
#> 4  NA    E     -101   
#> 5 -98.0  F     -  1.00
